text: Charlotte Köhler (born 1 July 1907) was a German track and field athlete, active during the 1920s, during the early era of women’s athletics in Germany. She was a member of Berliner SC and later Eintracht Frankfurt. In the 4 x 100 meters relay she was the world record holder. She was three times national champion. ==Biography== As a member of Berliner SC, Köhler had her main successes in the 4 x 100 metres relay. Next to the relay she also competed in the high jump, long jump and javelin throw. She won with the Berliner SC 4 x 100 meters relay team the bronze medal at the national championships in national champion in 1921, 1922 and 1923. The following three years, 1924, 1925 and 1926, she became with the team national champion and won again the bronze medal in 1927. Together with teammates Lilli Henoch, Cläre Voss and Gerda Pöting she set an official world record in the 4 × 100 meter relay in Köln on 11 July 1926 with a time of 50.3 seconds. The team set before on 13 July 1924 already the German national record with a time of 51.6 seconds. ==References== Category:1907 births Category:Javelin throwers Category:Long jumpers Category:High jumpers Category:Year of death missing Category:German sprinters Category:World record holders Category:German athletes
title: Charlotte Köhler
